title: dev-save_data
text: data downloaded luxembourguish Open Data Portal (data set called Série rétrospective des prix annoncés des maisons par commune, de 2010 à 2021), original data “Observatoire de l’habitat”. data contains prices houses sold since 2010 luxembourguish commune. function uses permanent URL Open Data Portal access data, also rehosted data, use link download data (archival purposes): need clean data: “Luxembourg” “Luxembourg-ville” 2010 2011, “Luxembourg”. “Pétange” also spelled non-consistently, also need convert columns right type. also directly remove rows locality contains information “Source”: now need make sure got communes/localities . mergers 2011, 2015 2018. need account localities. ’re now scraping data wikipedia former Luxembourguish communes: can scrape current communes: Let’s now create list communes: Let’s test see communes dataset represented. code doesn’t show communes, means accounting every commune. Let’s keep national average another dataset: can finish cleaning commune data: now save dataset folder analysis (keep chunk option eval = F avoid running knitting):
code: raw_data <- get_raw_data(url = "https://github.com/b-rodrigues/rap4all/raw/master/datasets/vente-maison-2010-2021.xlsx") #> New names: #> • `*` -> `*...3` #> • `*` -> `*...4` flat_data <- clean_raw_data(raw_data) #> Warning: There were 2 warnings in `mutate()`. #> The first warning was: #> ℹ In argument: `across(starts_with("average"), as.numeric)`. #> Caused by warning: #> ! NAs introduced by coercion #> ℹ Run `dplyr::last_dplyr_warnings()` to see the 1 remaining warning. former_communes <- get_former_communes() current_communes <- get_current_communes() former_communes <- get_former_communes() current_communes <- get_current_communes()  communes <- get_test_communes(former_communes, current_communes) #> Warning: Unknown or uninitialised column: `commune`. country_level_data <- make_country_level_data(flat_data) #> Joining with `by = join_by(year)` commune_level_data <- make_commune_level_data(flat_data)
